Description: Cream-coloured pottery ostracon, fragment from the rim of a vessel, with traces of one line of black-painted hieratic or early-demotic text.
Curator's comments: One of "about a dozen fragments of demotic inscriptions on pieces of jars and cups" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 74 § 71. Perhaps part of same vessel as EA 23781, 29484 and 29485.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 74 § 71)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (389618) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/389618)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.117, p.227, pl.69)
